questions.question_text_1: A six sided die is marked ‘1’ on two of its faces, ‘2’ on one of its faces, and ‘3’ on the remaining three faces. The die is thrown twice. Let X denotes the total score in two throws. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions

questions.question_text_1: A shopkeeper has two boxes of chocolates. Box-1 contains 5 dark chocolates and 4 white chocolates, while box-2 contains 3 dark chocolates and 3 white chocolates. A customer visits the shop to purchase a chocolate. If the shopkeeper randomly chooses a box and gives a chocolate from that chosen box, then what is the probability of the selected chocolate being white? (Enter the answer correct to two decimal places.)
question_texts: A shopkeeper has two boxes of chocolates. Box-1 contains 5 dark chocolates and 4 white chocolates, while box-2 contains 3 dark chocolates and 3 white chocolates. A customer visits the shop to purchase a chocolate. If the shopkeeper randomly chooses a box and gives a chocolate from that chosen box, then what is the probability of the selected chocolate being white? (Enter the answer correct to two decimal places.)

questions.question_text_1: An internet service provider advertises a download speed between 50 Mbps and 100 Mbps for its basic plan, which follows a uniform distribution. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions
question_texts: An internet service provider advertises a download speed between 50 Mbps and 100 Mbps for its basic plan, which follows a uniform distribution. Based on the given information, answer the subquestions

questions.question_text_1: What is the probability that a user on this plan will experience a download speed of exactly 60 Mbps?

questions.question_text_1: The time it takes for a computer system to reboot after a crash follows an exponential distribution with a mean time of 2 hours. What is the probability that the system will be back online within 1 hour of the crash?
question_texts: The time it takes for a computer system to reboot after a crash follows an exponential distribution with a mean time of 2 hours. What is the probability that the system will be back online within 1 hour of the crash?

questions.question_text_1: The number of earthquakes in a region follows a Poisson distribution, with an average rate of 0.3 earthquakes per week. What is the probability that there will be no earthquake in the next 14 days? (Note: 1 week = 7 days) (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)

questions.question_text_1: A quiz team of 5 students is to be chosen from a class of 6 boys and 4 girls. Find the probability that there is exactly 3 girls in the team out of the selected 5 students. (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)
question_texts: A quiz team of 5 students is to be chosen from a class of 6 boys and 4 girls. Find the probability that there is exactly 3 girls in the team out of the selected 5 students. (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal places.)

questions.question_text_1: A box contains 2 red pens, 3 black pens and 4 blue pens. In how many ways can 3 pens be drawn from the box, if at least one black pen is to be included?
question_texts: A box contains 2 red pens, 3 black pens and 4 blue pens. In how many ways can 3 pens be drawn from the box, if at least one black pen is to be included?
